conclusion: Objects A and B are in the air, and objects C, D, E, and F are placed on a surface.
When objects A and B fall due to gravity, they will come into contact with objects C, D, E, and F.
When objects A and B touch the surface where objects C, D, E, and F are located, they will likely cover or come to rest on top of these objects.
The first image shows objects A and B falling towards objects C, D, E, and F.
The second image shows objects A and B in contact with objects C, D, E, and F.
The third image shows objects A and B resting on objects C, D, E, and F, with fabric draped over them.
The fabric from objects A and B has covered objects C, D, E, and F, likely due to the momentum and positioning upon impact.
